intro: Pouteria campanulata, commonly known as the bell-shaped soursop, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces a fruit that is similar in appearance to the soursop but has a distinct flavor and texture. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and edible fruit. The tree can grow up to 10 meters tall and has a smooth, grayish bark.
